result.execSummary:
The defendant Trayvon D Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all SUpervision fees.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable, mandatory costs, fees & surcharges; to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition   of Extended Supervision.
Any amount remaining due & owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant remanded into custody.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.   
Obtain and maintan employment.  
Be given job and vocational training.

Defendant advised of the following restrictions: 
Firearm possession, 
Body armor possession and 
voting.

NO alcohol.  
NO controlled substances.  
NO CONTACT with victims, Monica L., Anthony W., Trevion B.
NO CONTACT with co-actors, Dashod Crutchfield & Dvontay Goodwin.

Mental Health assessment; treatment if needed.
Participate in Anger Management counseling.  
Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.

AODA assessment; treatment if needed.
Urine screens.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trayvon D Taylor

records.addlTxt: Petition for sentence adjustment returned as premature.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of PLEA & SENTENCING transcript commencing JULY 2, 2015, received and filed. (46 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  REQUIRED BY STATUTE

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Trayvon D Taylor not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Torbenson in trial in Branch 40.  Parties select a new date.  File retained in court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request to allow this case currently before Branch 02 to proceed with this case.  Clerk contacted the clerk in Branch 02 who did not object.  Court granted request to have this case transferred to Branch 20 to be handled with defendant's case 15CF897 before Branch 20.   The 7/17/15 date was vacated with the clerk's permission.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Trayvon D Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-17-2015 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Trayvon D Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
Case adjourned to 06-02-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant Trayvon D Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case adjourned to 05-04-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Trayvon D Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Per request of the State, and with permission of the clerk of Judge Donald, Court allowed case to be transferred back to Judge Donald, Branch 02, as that is ADA McNutt's court and defense counsel had no objection.  Parties request a scheduling date.  Court ordered case adjourned before Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of PRELIMINAY HEARING transcript commencing MARCH 31, 2015 received and filed. (13 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY STEPHEN SARGENT, 819 NORTH 6TH STREET, MILWAUKEE,WI 53203. kl

Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steven Johnson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.   Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Trayvon D Taylor
Current: 2410 N 49th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 03-24-2015)
Prior: 3129 North 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TB and AW, and co-defendants Dashod Crutchfield and Dvontay Goodwin.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
